Speaker: guy
Dialogue: I don't know. The beach can be sort of nice in the winter. Romantic.

Dialogue: So were you a Rehobeth beach family or Stone Harbor?

Dialogue: Me too.

Dialogue: Stone Harbor is the Jersey shore.

Dialogue: Fine. Whatever. I'm getting in. You're welcome to join me.  He turns and trudges back to the Oldsmobile, climbs in, and pulls the door shut after him. Leaving her there in the snowy road, clutching the scissors, her teeth chattering.  She stands there, shivering, looking very small and alone.  HOLD on her as she weighs her options: stay out here and freeze. Or risk seeking shelter with a stalker.  Not much of a choice.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: I don't know. They don't cover this

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: What about that book, in the back?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: What book?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Something Book of the Dead.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Tibetan. It's not a How-to manual. It's an 8th century Buddhist guide on death and dying.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: God. Why is this happening to us?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: I can feel your stomach rumbling.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: I know. God, I'd give anything for some of those Carr's crackers right now...

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Um, let's see. Duck liver pat with truffles.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Oh no...

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Some olives, the normal kind and also some of the little shrivelled black ones. A bottle of white wine...

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Mmmmm...

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: And for dessert, anisette biscotti and a thermos of espresso.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Ohhhh...

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Can't be too much longer until dawn. Someone's bound to come along then. A snowplow or something. Right?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: How are your hands?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Starting to burn...

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: That's good. It means the circulation's coming back.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Yeah, but I mean really burn...

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Hang on. I think I have a few Tylenol-with-codeine in my purse.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: What's taking so long, nurse -

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: I just-

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Priests!

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: "... Hearing the crash on nearby Route 606, they braved inclement weather to administer Last Rights..."

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: That must be what we saw them doing!

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: "... also killed was State Highway Patrolman... continued on page seven."

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: You got that Tylenol?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Coming.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: I'll go first. You get some sleep.

Speaker: brenda lee
Dialogue: Rockin' around, the Christmas tree, at the Christ-mas par-ty hop. She freezes.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Thank god! You were having some kind of seizure or someth-

Speaker: brenda lee
Dialogue: You will get a sen-ti-men-tal fee- ling when you hear... Voices singing "Let's be jolly, DECK the halls with boughs of holly"... The car's rear window brightens with APPROACHING HEADLIGHTS of a highway patrol car, it's strobe light flooding the Oldsmobile's interior with RED.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: What's happening!?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: It's him! Hurry! Help me!

Speaker: brenda lee
Dialogue: Rockin' around, the Christmas tree, Have a happy hol-i-day... Our guy claps hands over his ears so he can't hear the sound of the cop's rage as he attacks the car, fury growing and growing until it's indistinguishable from the HOWLING wind outside.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: I think... he's gone. I guess when he couldn't get in he gave up.  I told you these `88 Olds were built like tanks!

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Shhh! How do you know it's not a trick! He could still be out there waiting-

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: He's not! Listen!

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: But what if he comes back..?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: We just have to stay in the car until morning. Then we'll be safe. That can't be more than, like, a few more hours... Someone's bound to come along once the sun comes up... Someone human I mean. Think you can hold on until then?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: What if, you know. We have to pee?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: We can use the empty water bottles. From this point on, the back seat is a co-ed bathroom. Sound like a plan?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: I don't want to sleep.  He nods, understanding.  So they just hunker down in the front seat, staring at the snow covered windshield, and start the long wait to morning.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: I gotta pee...

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Again?!

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Stop talking.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: You should ask Santa to bring you a bigger bladder.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: I'm serious! It's hard enough doing this in front of you.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: What, are you one of those people who can't pee with the bathroom door open?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: No. But it's not something I usually do until much later in a relationship...

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: No big deal. Just your average day in the NHL...

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: How long have you known?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Since I tried hiking back to the gas station. You were right, I never got anywhere near it. I

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Why didn't you tell me?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: I didn't want to scare you-

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: We've got to get you some help now. You won't make it to morning. I'm going to try and hike back to the gas station-

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: How far do you think you'd get out there before running into Mr. Freeze?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: I'm not going to just sit here and watch you die!

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: What are you looking at?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Telephone poles. They must have a junction box or something to test the lines ... There! See that one?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: So?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: So maybe there's some way I can... I don't know... jack into it or something. Try and call for help.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: You want to climb a telephone pole?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Of course I don't want to! But it's got rungs. Can't be any harder than the climbing wall at my gym. Big fat repair guys do it all the time, right? Right?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: But you're forgetting one thing...

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: He's out there.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: The song! That old Christmas song on the radio. It always comes on just before he shows up...

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: I've been thinking...

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: What about?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Eternal recurrence. Maybe it wouldn't be so bad.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: What wouldn't?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Repeating this life. Over and over. Exactly the same each time.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Even the last twenty-four hours?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Know what I'd do different? Next time I'd just to walk up to you after class... and say "Hey."

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: You should. Definitely. Do that.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Don't let me die out here-

Speaker: radio psa
Dialogue: The State Weather Bureau has issued an extreme cold warning...

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: No!!!

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: Nine-one-one emergency response.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Thank god! Hi! Hello! We need help!

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: What's that? Can you repeat-

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: We're on highway 606! Oh god, please hurry! We need help! My friend is hurt-

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: Can you repeat your-

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Hello? Hello?  The connection SPARKS and she feels a small shock that makes her drop the phone. When she retrieves it and holds it back to her ear the line is DEAD.  No way of knowing if her message got through.  It's a moment of such soul-crushing despair she shuts her eyes and leans her head against the pole, as if wanting to just quietly die up here thirty feet above the earth.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: - I did it - got through - but I don't know how much she understood - the operator I mean -

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Sorry... sorry... I'm sorry...

Speaker: snowplow driver
Dialogue: You kids okay?

Speaker: snowplow driver
Dialogue: Dispatch, come in...

Speaker: snowplow driver
Dialogue: I'm out at the site of that reported accident on 606. One of them didn't make it. I'm taking the other directly to the trauma unit in Hadleyville.

Speaker: snowplow driver
Dialogue: Been some real bad accidents on this road over the years. When I was growing up, there was a family from New York City found out here froze solid-

Speaker: snowplow driver
Dialogue: ... fire department had to hose them down with hot water for two hours to thaw them out. I remember back in high school there was a stupid rumor going around if you went driving out here on moonless nights and looked up in your rearview, you might see the dead baby in your backseat ...

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: What about those ruins up on the hill? The retirement home for old priests?

Speaker: snowplow driver
Dialogue: Tragic story. Winter of `61 they were all found froze to death in their beds...

Speaker: snowplow driver
Dialogue: Must've been a pilot on the boiler went out, or something...

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: It's not Tom...

Speaker: snowplow driver
Dialogue: Doesn't this stupid son of a gun realize we're bigger than him?! No way he's going to win this fight!

Speaker: snowplow driver
Dialogue: Hang on, officer, I'm coming...

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: No!!!

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Wait! Don't go down there! Stop!

Speaker: snowplow driver
Dialogue: Hang on, officer! We'll get you out!

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: No!!! Don't go near it!!!

Speaker: snowplow driver
Dialogue: What!!? We have to get him out of there...

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Doesn't matter! He's already dead!

Speaker: snowplow driver
Dialogue: What the hell are you talking about?

Speaker: highway patrolman
Dialogue: Should've known you vultures would turn up...

Speaker: snowplow driver
Dialogue: Try not to move, officer, you might have a neck injury.

Speaker: highway patrolman
Dialogue: What are you waiting for, a letter from the Bishop?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Come on. We can go now. It's over.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Come on, come on!

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Get away from her, you bastard!

Speaker: cellphone
Dialogue: Ding-da-da DING, da-DING da-DING... Her eyes widen in terror. She fumbles out the cellphone. Stabs the "off" button with her thumb.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Wait!

Speaker: guy's ghost
Dialogue: ...I would've told you everything eventually...

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: guy's ghost
Dialogue: ...then it wouldn't be stalkerish.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: I know!

Speaker: guy's ghost
Dialogue: ... It would just be this sweet funny story we'd have...
